intro: Crotalaria amadiensis var. butayei, commonly known as the Butayei crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, known for its nitrogen-fixing abilities, which contribute to soil fertility. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
